snippet: A dating show helped set off the toughest crackdown on television in years, exposing the tension at the heart of the Communist Party’s control of entertainment.
abstract: Popular Chinese reality television show If You Are the One has helped set off the toughest crackdown on television in years in the country, with regulators formulating a sweeping policy that effectively wipes out scores of shows on prime-time television; move exposes the growing tension at the heart of the Communist Party's control of the entertainment industry.

byline.contributor: Li Bibo and Edy Yin contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A dating show helped set off the toughest crackdown on television in years, exposing the tension at the heart of the Communist Party’s control of entertainment.

headline.print_headline: China TV Grows Racy, and Gets a Chaperon
headline.seo: Censors Pull Reins as China TV, Chasing Profit, Gets Racy
headline.main: China TV Grows Racy, and Gets a Chaperon
